did.abstract: Contains addresses, brochures or pamphlets, bulletins or college catalogs, histories and manuals. Includes the newsletter Medicine at Michigan as well as miscellaneous reports about the Medical School. Also contains publications from the Center for Molecular Genetics, Office of Biomedical Research, Office of Medical Education, Galens Medical Society and the Phi Chi fraternity.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: Publications are received periodically from the unit (donor # 647).

userestrict.p: Copyright is held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: item, folder title, box no., Medical School (University of Michigan) Publications, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: See the historical sketch in the finding aid for the Medical School (University of Michigan) Records.

scopecontent.p: The Medical School Publications are divided into four series: Unit Publications, Sub-Unit Publications, Topical Publications and Student Publications. Some publications (or their successors) may no longer be available in print but are available on the school s website.

scopecontent.p: The Unit Publications Series (1.5 linear feet) contains two addresses, including one by Dr. W.B. Hinsdale; an announcement of the requirements for admission from 1909; and one annual report from 1939/40. Also included in this series are an almost complete run of Medical School bulletins from 1850 to the present. Four histories of the School, from 1901, 1939, 1950 and 1967, are found here. In 1849, a special committee submitted a report to the Board of Regents recommending the organization of a medical department in the University. This report can be found in Box 2.

scopecontent.p: Under Sub-Unit Publications (2.5 linear feet) are publications from the various departments, committees, centers and other groups contained within the school. Two units from the Office of the Dean are represented in this series. Box 3 contains proposals and reports by the Dean's Committee on Curriculum Improvement. In Box 4 the researcher can find various policy statements and proposals (bulk dates 1975-1979) from the Dean's Medical Service Plan, which allowed full-time faculty to earn compensation for private medical practice, in conjunction with the University Hospitals.
Other sub-units represented in this series include: the Center for Molecular Genetics, the Office of Medical Education and the Office of Student Affairs and Minority Affairs.

scopecontent.p: The Topical Publications series contains programs and invitations from Medical School Alumni Reunions, commencement activities, conferences and symposia, and opening exercises.

scopecontent.p: The Student Publications series (.5 linear feet) contains newsletters from the Black Medical Association and the Phi Chi Medical Fraternity, as well as two student handbooks produced by the Medical Student Council, and an Alumni Directory (1969) from the Galens Honorary Medical Society. The bulk of this series is composed of the student newsletter, The Paeon, which ran regularly from 1968, then intermittently since the beginning of the 1980's.
The Medical School yearbook Aequanimitas, is individually catalogued under the call number Fimu C41. The Bentley Historical Library holds a nearly complete run from 1957 through 1995.

Student Handbook U of M Medical School, 1977/78

scopecontent.p: The Archived Medical School Website documents the academic programs, accomplishments, resources, events, and people at the School. Content includes important news and announcements, publications (such as newsletters and course catalogs), and information about admissions, curriculum, degree requirements, faculty, and the overall mission of the School. Starting in 2010, this archived website will be captured on a regular, ongoing basis as part of the University of Michigan Web Archives, hosted at http://webarchives.cdlib.org/a/universityofmichigan/.

did.unittitle: Archived websites related to the Medical School 2010-[ongoing]
